ground_truth: Harry has donned Hermione's scarf and Ron's hat to disguise himself as Fudge looks around nervously and then jerks his head toward the pub. As he leads Rosmerta and McGonagall inside, we cut back to Hermione and Ron. Footprints track through the snow into the pub, as Ron and Hermione ripple briefly past a frosted window. Three shrunken heads swing into view while Rosmerta looks to McGonagall, who nods grimly. Suddenly, the pub doors fly open, revealing Main Street, where Ron and Hermione wait, rubbing their hands against the chill. As they look down, the camera tilts and footprints appear in the snow, marking the end of Harry's point of view. At the end of a rocky outcrop, the footprints end and sobs are heard. Ron takes Hermione's arm to discourage her from going further, but she does, filling the footprints with her own, then kneeling and gently drawing the cloak from Harry, who stares into the mist with eyes stinging with tears. Butterflies flutter over the great green lawn, the giant squid breaks through the last glaze of ice on the Black Lake, and the Whomping Willow shakes the water from its branches as the dying sun streams through high windows, painting Harry's face a fierce amber-red as he stands opposite Lupin. Ancient charts drape the walls while gleaming spheres of spun glass orbit one another silently, and Lupin paces before a large trunk. Harry shakes his head, and as his eyes wander, Lupin snaps his fingers to bring his attention back, then nods. Crack! The Dementor mutates into a silvery white orb, and Harry glances toward the window at the bloody sun, then looks up into Lupin's eyes, emotional, and nods. Harry takes a breath as Lupin blinks at Harry's quiet fierceness and opens the packing case, instantly causing the Dementor to appear again. The hair skates off Harry's scar as he sets his jaw, his hand trembling, and his whole body trembling, but he holds his ground when a huge silver shadow bursts from the end of his wand, hovering between him and the Dementor, which falters. Lupin nods as all the boys are asleep except Harry, who lies in bed studying the photo of his parents, barely visible in the fluttering light of a guttering candle. The camera begins to move, creeping forward, but it's only an old man in a painting, scowling in the glare of Harry's wand light. Harry makes to follow, then stops as the wand's spot dances across the parchment and finds another dot. Harry stashes the map, extinguishes his wand, and turns into the harsh glare of Snape's wand. A sneer curdles the corners of Snape's lips as he eyes Harry coldly, lowering his wand. Seeing the map, Snape's eyes glitter, and to Harry's horror, words begin to appear as Snape studies him with a sadistic half-smile on his lips.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Harry has put on Hermione's muffler and Ron's cap to disguise himself as Fudge glances around anxiously and then jerks his head toward the tavern. As he guides Rosmerta and McGonagall indoors, we switch back to Hermione and Ron. Footprints track through the snow into the inn, as Ron and Hermione ripple briefly past a frosted pane. Three shrunken heads swing into sight while Rosmerta glances to McGonagall, who nods grimly. Suddenly, the pub doors fly open, revealing Main Street, where Ron and Hermione wait, rubbing their hands against the chill. As they glance down, the camera tilts and footprints appear in the snow, marking the conclusion of Harry's perspective. At the termination of a rocky promontory, the footprints cease and sobs are heard. Ron takes Hermione's arm to discourage her from going further, but she does, filling the tracks with her own, then kneeling and gently drawing the cloak from Harry, who stares into the haze with eyes stinging with tears. Butterflies flutter over the vast verdant lawn, the giant squid breaks through the last glaze of ice on the Black Lake, and the Whomping Willow shakes the water from its limbs as the dying sun streams through tall windows, painting Harry's face a fierce amber-red as he stands opposite Lupin. Ancient charts drape the walls while gleaming spheres of spun glass orbit one another silently, and Lupin strides before a large chest. Harry shakes his head, and as his eyes wander, Lupin snaps his fingers to bring his attention back, then nods. Crack! The Dementor transforms into a silvery white globe, and Harry glances toward the window at the bloody sun, then looks up into Lupin's eyes, emotional, and nods. Harry takes a breath as Lupin blinks at Harry's quiet intensity and opens the trunk, instantly causing the Dementor to appear again. The hair slides off Harry's scar as he sets his jaw, his hand trembling, and his whole body quivering, but he holds his ground when a huge silver shadow bursts from the termination of his wand, hovering between him and the Dementor, which falters. Lupin nods as all the boys are asleep except Harry, who lies in bed studying the photo of his parents, barely visible in the fluttering light of a guttering candle. The camera begins to move, creeping forward, but it's only an old man in a painting, scowling in the glare of Harry's wand light. Harry makes to follow, then stops as the wand's spot dances across the parchment and discovers another dot. Harry stashes the map, extinguishes his wand, and turns into the harsh glare of Snape's wand. A sneer curdles the corners of Snape's lips as he eyes Harry coldly, lowering his wand. Seeing the map, Snape's eyes glitter, and to Harry's horror, words begin to appear as Snape examines him with a sadistic half-smile on his lips.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Hermione's scarf and Ron's hat have been donned by Harry to disguise himself as Fudge, who looks around nervously and then jerks his head toward the pub. Rosmerta and McGonagall are led inside by him, and we cut back to Hermione and Ron. The snow is tracked through by footprints into the pub, as Ron and Hermione are briefly rippled past a frosted window. While Rosmerta looks to McGonagall, who nods grimly, three shrunken heads swing into view. Suddenly, the pub doors are flown open, revealing Main Street, where Ron and Hermione are waiting, rubbing their hands against the chill. As they look down, the camera tilts, and footprints are made to appear in the snow, marking the end of Harry's point of view. At the end of a rocky outcrop, where the footprints end, sobs are heard. Hermione's arm is taken by Ron to discourage her from going further, but she does, filling the footprints with her own, then she kneels and gently draws the cloak from Harry, who stares into the mist with eyes stinging with tears. Over the great green lawn, butterflies are made to flutter, the giant squid breaks through the last glaze of ice on the Black Lake, and the water is shaken from its branches by the Whomping Willow as the dying sun streams through high windows, painting Harry's face a fierce amber-red as he stands opposite Lupin. The walls are draped with ancient charts while spheres of spun glass orbit one another silently, and before a large trunk, Lupin paces. Harry's head is shaken, and as his eyes wander, his attention is brought back by Lupin snapping his fingers, then he nods. Crack! The Dementor mutates into a silvery white orb, and Harry's glance is turned toward the window at the bloody sun, then he looks up into Lupin's eyes, emotional, and nods. A breath is taken by Harry as Lupin blinks at Harry's quiet fierceness and opens the packing case, instantly causing the Dementor to appear again. Harry's scar is skated off by the hair as he sets his jaw, his hand trembling, and his whole body trembling, but when a huge silver shadow is burst from the end of his wand, hovering between him and the Dementor, which falters, he holds his ground. All the boys are nodded at by Lupin as they are asleep except Harry, who lies in bed studying the photo of his parents, barely visible in the fluttering light of a guttering candle. The camera is begun to be moved by it, creeping forward, but it's only an old man in a painting, who scowls in the glare of Harry's wand light. Following is made to by Harry, then he stops as the wand's spot dances across the parchment and finds another dot. The map is stashed by Harry, his wand is extinguished, and he is turned into the harsh glare of Snape's wand. The corners of Snape's lips are curdled by a sneer as he eyes Harry coldly, lowering his wand. Seeing the map, the eyes of Snape glitter, and to Harry's horror, words begin to appear as Snape studies him with a sadistic half-smile on his lips.

Snape sneers, lowers his wand, and seeing the map, his eyes glitter as words appear, and he studies Harry with a sadistic half-smile.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Harry, in an effort to disguise himself, has put on Hermione's scarf and Ron's hat. Meanwhile, Fudge, looking around with a nervous demeanor, jerks his head toward the pub, signaling for them to move. As he leads Rosmerta and McGonagall inside, the scene shifts back to Hermione and Ron. Footprints are visible, tracking through the snow and leading into the pub, while Ron and Hermione briefly ripple past a frosted window. Three shrunken heads swing into view, and Rosmerta glances at McGonagall, who responds with a grim nod. Suddenly, the pub doors burst open, revealing Main Street, where Ron and Hermione stand waiting, rubbing their hands together to ward off the chill. As they look down, the camera tilts, revealing footprints in the snow, marking the end of Harry's perspective. At the edge of a rocky outcrop, the footprints abruptly stop, and the sound of sobbing is heard. Ron gently takes Hermione's arm, trying to discourage her from going further, but she persists, stepping into the footprints with her own. She then kneels down and gently draws the cloak away from Harry, who is staring into the mist, his eyes stinging with tears. Butterflies flutter over the expansive green lawn, the giant squid breaks through the last thin glaze of ice on the Black Lake, and the Whomping Willow shakes the water from its branches as the dying sun streams through high windows, casting a fierce amber-red glow on Harry's face as he stands opposite Lupin. Ancient charts drape the walls, and gleaming spheres of spun glass orbit one another silently, while Lupin paces back and forth before a large trunk. Harry shakes his head, and as his eyes wander, Lupin snaps his fingers to bring Harry's attention back, then nods. Crack! The Dementor transforms into a silvery white orb, and Harry glances toward the window at the bloody sun, then looks up into Lupin's eyes, filled with emotion, and nods. Harry takes a deep breath as Lupin blinks at Harry's quiet fierceness and opens the packing case, instantly causing the Dementor to reappear. The hair skates off Harry's scar as he sets his jaw, his hand trembling, and his whole body quivering, but he holds his ground when a huge silver shadow bursts from the end of his wand, hovering protectively between him and the Dementor, which falters. Lupin nods approvingly as all the boys are asleep except for Harry, who lies in bed studying the photo of his parents, barely visible in the flickering light of a guttering candle. The camera begins to move, creeping forward, but it's only an old man in a painting, scowling in the glare of Harry's wand light. Harry makes to follow, then stops as the wand's spot dances across the parchment and finds another dot. Harry quickly stashes the map, extinguishes his wand, and turns into the harsh glare of Snape's wand. A sneer curls the corners of Snape's lips as he eyes Harry coldly, lowering his wand. Seeing the map, Snape's eyes glitter with interest, and to Harry's horror, words begin to appear as Snape studies him with a sadistic half-smile playing on his lips.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: In an attempt to conceal his identity, Harry has taken the precaution of donning Hermione's colorful scarf and Ron's distinctive hat. Meanwhile, Fudge, exhibiting a nervous and slightly jittery demeanor, glances around cautiously before sharply jerking his head in the direction of the pub, signaling urgently for them to make their move. As he leads Rosmerta and McGonagall inside the pub, the scene shifts focus back to Hermione and Ron. Footprints are clearly visible, marking a path through the freshly fallen snow and leading into the warmly lit pub, while Ron and Hermione pass briefly in front of a frosted window, their silhouettes rippling momentarily. Three shrunken heads suddenly swing into view, and Rosmerta exchanges a glance with McGonagall, who responds with a grim, resolute nod. Abruptly, the doors of the pub burst open, revealing the bustling Main Street, where Ron and Hermione stand waiting patiently, rubbing their hands together in an effort to ward off the biting chill. As they direct their gaze downward, the camera tilts, revealing the footprints in the snow, which mark the conclusion of Harry's perspective. At the very edge of a rocky outcrop, the footprints come to an unexpected halt, accompanied by the faint sound of sobbing echoing in the distance. Ron gently takes hold of Hermione's arm, attempting to dissuade her from proceeding any further, but she persists determinedly, stepping into the footprints with her own. She then kneels down, gently pulling the cloak away from Harry, who is gazing into the mist, his eyes stinging with unshed tears. Butterflies flutter delicately over the expansive green lawn, while the giant squid breaks through the last remnants of thin ice on the surface of the Black Lake. Simultaneously, the Whomping Willow shakes the droplets of water from its branches as the setting sun streams through the high windows, casting a fierce amber-red glow onto Harry's face as he stands across from Lupin. Ancient charts hang from the walls, and spheres of spun glass gleaming silently orbit one another, while Lupin paces back and forth anxiously in front of a large trunk. Harry shakes his head in apparent confusion, and as his eyes wander distractedly, Lupin snaps his fingers sharply to bring Harry's attention back to the present moment, then nods in understanding. Crack! The Dementor transforms into a brilliant silvery white orb, and Harry glances toward the window at the bloody sun, then meets Lupin's eyes, which are filled with deep emotion, and nods in acknowledgment. Harry takes a deep breath as Lupin blinks in response to Harry's quiet fierceness and opens the packing case, instantly causing the Dementor to reappear menacingly. The hair skates off Harry's scar as he sets his jaw with determination, his hand trembling, and his whole body quivering, yet he stands firm when a large silver shadow erupts from the tip of his wand, hovering protectively between him and the Dementor, which falters momentarily. Lupin nods with approval as all the boys are asleep, except for Harry, who lies in bed intently studying the photograph of his parents, barely visible in the flickering light of a guttering candle. The camera begins to move stealthily forward, but it's only an old man in a painting, scowling irritably in the glare of Harry's wand light. Harry prepares to follow, then abruptly stops as the wand's light dances across the parchment and uncovers another dot. Harry quickly stashes the map away, extinguishes his wand, and turns into the harsh glare of Snape's wand. A sneer curls the corners of Snape's lips as he regards Harry with cold eyes, slightly lowering his wand. Seeing the map, Snape's eyes glitter with keen interest, and to Harry's horror, words materialize as Snape studies him with a sadistic half-smile playing on his lips.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Harry carefully wraps Hermione's scarf around his neck and places Ron's hat on his head, attempting to disguise himself as Fudge nervously scans the surroundings, his eyes darting back and forth before he abruptly jerks his head in the direction of the pub. With a sense of urgency, he leads Rosmerta and McGonagall inside, and the scene shifts back to Hermione and Ron. Footprints are visible in the snow, leading into the pub, while Ron and Hermione briefly ripple past a frosted window, their figures momentarily distorted by the glass. Inside, three shrunken heads swing into view, and Rosmerta turns to McGonagall, who responds with a grim nod. Suddenly, the pub doors burst open, revealing Main Street, where Ron and Hermione stand waiting, rubbing their hands together to ward off the biting cold. As they lower their gaze, the camera tilts downward, revealing footprints in the snow, marking the conclusion of Harry's perspective. At the edge of a rocky outcrop, the footprints abruptly end, and the sound of sobbing fills the air. Ron gently takes Hermione's arm, attempting to dissuade her from proceeding further, but she persists, stepping forward to fill the footprints with her own. She then kneels down, carefully drawing the cloak away from Harry, who gazes into the mist, his eyes stinging with unshed tears. Meanwhile, butterflies flutter over the expansive green lawn, the giant squid breaks through the remaining ice on the Black Lake, and the Whomping Willow shakes water from its branches as the dying sun streams through high windows, casting a fierce amber-red glow on Harry's face as he stands opposite Lupin. The walls are draped with ancient charts, and gleaming spheres of spun glass orbit one another silently as Lupin paces before a large trunk. Harry shakes his head, his eyes wandering until Lupin snaps his fingers, bringing Harry's attention back, and then nods. With a sharp crack, the Dementor transforms into a silvery white orb, and Harry glances toward the window at the blood-red sun before looking up into Lupin's eyes, filled with emotion, and nods. Harry takes a deep breath as Lupin blinks at Harry's quiet determination and opens the packing case, causing the Dementor to reappear instantly. The hair skates off Harry's scar as he sets his jaw, his hand trembling, and his entire body quivering, yet he stands firm as a huge silver shadow erupts from the end of his wand, hovering protectively between him and the Dementor, which falters. Lupin nods approvingly as all the boys are asleep except for Harry, who lies in bed, studying the photo of his parents, barely visible in the flickering light of a guttering candle. The camera begins to move, creeping forward, but it's only an old man in a painting, scowling in the glare of Harry's wand light. Harry makes to follow, then hesitates as the wand's light dances across the parchment and discovers another dot. He quickly stashes the map, extinguishes his wand, and turns to face the harsh glare of Snape's wand. A sneer twists the corners of Snape's lips as he regards Harry coldly, lowering his wand. Upon seeing the map, Snape's eyes glitter with interest, and to Harry's horror, words begin to appear as Snape studies him with a sadistic half-smile playing on his lips.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Harry disguises himself with Hermione's scarf and Ron's hat as Fudge nervously gestures toward the pub, leading Rosmerta and McGonagall inside. Meanwhile, Ron and Hermione's footprints appear in the snow outside the pub, briefly visible through a frosted window. Inside, Rosmerta exchanges a grim nod with McGonagall. The pub doors swing open to reveal Ron and Hermione on Main Street, rubbing their hands against the cold. They notice footprints in the snow, marking the end of Harry's perspective. At a rocky outcrop, the footprints stop, and sobs are heard. Ron tries to hold Hermione back, but she continues, filling the footprints with her own before kneeling to reveal Harry, who is tearful and staring into the mist.

As the scene shifts, butterflies flutter over the lawn, the giant squid breaks through the ice on the Black Lake, and the Whomping Willow shakes off water as the setting sun casts an amber-red glow on Harry's face. He stands opposite Lupin in a room adorned with ancient charts and orbiting glass spheres. Lupin paces before a large trunk, and after snapping Harry back to attention, he nods. With a crack, the Dementor transforms into a silvery orb. Harry, emotional, nods back at Lupin, then takes a breath as Lupin opens the trunk, releasing the Dementor again. Despite trembling, Harry stands firm, casting a huge silver shadow from his wand that hovers between him and the Dementor, causing it to falter. Lupin nods approvingly.

Later, as the other boys sleep, Harry lies in bed, studying a photo of his parents by candlelight. The camera moves forward, revealing an old man in a painting scowling in the wand's glare. Harry prepares to follow but stops when the wand's light reveals another dot on the Marauder's Map. He quickly stashes the map, extinguishes his wand, and turns to face Snape's harsh glare. Snape lowers his wand, sneering as he notices the map. To Harry's horror, words begin to appear on the map as Snape studies him with a sadistic half-smile.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Harry has donned Hermione's scarf, an item she knitted over the summer when house colors were all the rage, and Ron's hat, a gift from his mother for cold winter nights, to disguise himself as Fudge, the current Minister of Magic known for his anxious demeanor, looks around nervously and then jerks his head toward the pub, The Hog's Head, notorious among locals for its secretive meetings. As he leads Rosmerta, the pub owner known for her charm and intelligence, and McGonagall, the stern Deputy Headmistress of Hogwarts, inside, we cut back to Hermione and Ron. Footprints track through the snow into the pub, as Ron and Hermione ripple briefly past a frosted window, signaling their movement while under the Invisibility Cloak. Three shrunken heads, a curious decoration from the Caribbean, swing into view while Rosmerta looks to McGonagall, who nods grimly. Suddenly, the pub doors fly open, revealing Main Street of Hogsmeade, a village unique for being entirely magical, where Ron and Hermione wait, rubbing their hands against the chill. As they look down, the camera tilts and footprints appear in the snow, marking the end of Harry's point of view. At the end of a rocky outcrop, notorious for its steep edges, the footprints end and sobs are heard. Ron takes Hermione's arm to discourage her from going further, but she does, filling the footprints with her own, then kneeling and gently drawing the cloak from Harry, who stares into the mist with eyes stinging with tears. Butterflies flutter over the great green lawn of Hogwarts, the magical school where they all study, the giant squid breaks through the last glaze of ice on the Black Lake, a deep body of water teeming with magical creatures, and the Whomping Willow, a tree planted decades ago to guard a secret, shakes the water from its branches as the dying sun streams through high windows of the castle, painting Harry's face a fierce amber-red as he stands opposite Lupin, the newly appointed Defense Against the Dark Arts professor. Ancient charts, detailing celestial movements and magical territories, drape the walls while gleaming spheres of spun glass, enchantments for teaching astronomy, orbit one another silently, and Lupin paces before a large trunk, containing a Boggart. Harry shakes his head, and as his eyes wander, Lupin snaps his fingers, a habit developed from years of teaching, to bring his attention back, then nods. Crack! The Dementor, a creature used by the Ministry to guard Azkaban, mutates into a silvery white orb, responding to Harry's Patronus attempt, and Harry glances toward the window at the bloody sun, then looks up into Lupin's eyes, emotional, and nods. Harry takes a breath as Lupin blinks at Harry's quiet fierceness and opens the packing case, instantly causing the Dementor to appear again. The hair skates off Harry's scar, a remnant of a deadly curse, as he sets his jaw, his hand trembling, and his whole body trembling, but he holds his ground when a huge silver shadow, his Patronus, bursts from the end of his wand, hovering between him and the Dementor, which falters. Lupin nods as all the boys in Gryffindor Tower are asleep except Harry, who lies in bed studying the photo of his parents, James and Lily Potter, barely visible in the fluttering light of a guttering candle. The camera begins to move, creeping forward, but it's only an old man in a painting, scowling in the glare of Harry's wand light. Harry makes to follow, then stops as the wand's spot dances across the Marauder's Map and finds another dot. Harry stashes the map, extinguishes his wand, and turns into the harsh glare of Snape's wand, the Potions Master with a long-standing grudge against Harry's father. A sneer curdles the corners of Snape's lips as he eyes Harry coldly, lowering his wand. Seeing the map, a magical item created by Harry's father and his friends, Snape's eyes glitter, and to Harry's horror, words begin to appear as Snape studies him with a sadistic half-smile on his lips.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: Harry has donned Hermione's scarf and Ron's hat to disguise himself as Fudge looks around nervously and then jerks his head toward the pub. As he leads Rosmerta and McGonagall inside we cut back to Hermione and Ron. Footprints track through the snow into the pub as Ron and Hermione ripple briefly past a frosted window. Three shrunken heads swing into view while Rosmerta looks to McGonagall who nods grimly. Suddenly the pub doors fly open revealing Main Street where Ron and Hermione wait rubbing their hands against the chill. As they look down the camera tilts and footprints appear in the snow marking the end of Harry's point of view. At the end of a rocky outcrop the footprints end and sobs are heard. Ron takes Hermione's arm to discourage her from going further but she does filling the footprints with her own then kneeling and gently drawing the cloak from Harry who stares into the mist with eyes stinging with tears. Butterflies flutter over the great green lawn. the giant squid breaks through the last glaze of ice on the Black Lake and the Whomping Willow shakes the water from its branches as the dying sun streams through high windows painting Harry's face a fierce amberred as he stands opposite Lupin. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. Ancient charts drape the walls while gleaming spheres of spun glass orbit one another silently and Lupin paces before a large trunk. Harry shakes his head and as his eyes wander Lupin snaps his fingers to bring his attention back then nods Crack. The Dementor mutates into a silvery white orb and Harry glances toward the window at the bloody sun then looks up into Lupin's eyes emotional and nods. Harry takes a breath as Lupin blinks at Harry's quiet fierceness and opens the packing case instantly causing the Dementor to appear again. The hair skates off Harry's scar as he sets his jaw his hand trembling and his whole body trembling but he holds his ground when a huge silver shadow bursts from the end of his wand hovering between him and the Dementor which falters. Lupin nods as all the boys are asleep except Harry who lies in bed studying the photo of his parents barely visible in the fluttering light of a guttering candle. The camera begins to move creeping forward but it is only an old man in a painting scowling in the glare of Harry's wand light. Harry makes to follow then stops as the wand's spot dances across the parchment and finds another dot. Harry stashes the map extinguishes his wand and turns into the harsh glare of Snape's wand. A sneer curdles the corners of Snape's lips as he eyes Harry coldly lowering his wand. Seeing the map Snape's eyes glitter and to Harry's horror words begin to appear as Snape studies him with a sadistic halfsmile on his lips.

Butterflies flutter over the great green lawn, the giant squid breaks through the last glaze of ice on the Black Lake, and the Whomping Willow shakes the water from its branches as the dying sun streams through high windows, painting Ginny's face a fierce amber-red as she stands opposite Tonks. Ancient charts drape the walls while gleaming spheres of spun glass orbit one another silently, and Tonks paces before a large trunk. Ginny shakes her head, and as her eyes wander, Tonks snaps her fingers to bring her attention back, then nods. Crack! The Dementor mutates into a silvery white orb, and Ginny glances toward the window at the bloody sun, then looks up into Tonks's eyes, emotional, and nods. Ginny takes a breath as Tonks blinks at Ginny's quiet fierceness and opens the packing case, instantly causing the Dementor to appear again. The hair skates off Ginny's scar as she sets her jaw, her hand trembling, and her whole body trembling, but she holds her ground when a huge silver shadow bursts from the end of her wand, hovering between her and the Dementor, which falters. Tonks nods as all the boys are asleep except Ginny, who lies in bed studying the photo of her parents, barely visible in the fluttering light of a guttering candle. The camera begins to move, creeping forward, but it's only a centaur in a painting, scowling in the glare of Ginny's wand light. Ginny makes to follow, then stops as the wand's spot dances across the parchment and finds another dot. Ginny stashes the map, extinguishes her wand, and turns into the harsh glare of Filch's wand. A sneer curdles the corners of Filch's lips as he eyes Ginny coldly, lowering his wand. Seeing the map, Filch's eyes glitter, and to Ginny's horror, words begin to appear as Filch studies her with a sadistic half-smile on his lips.

Three bronze busts swing into view while Rosmerta looks to McGonagall, who nods grimly. Suddenly, the library doors fly open, revealing Main Circle, where Ron and Hermione wait, rubbing their hands against the chill. As they look down, the camera tilts and footprints appear in the sand, marking the end of Harry's point of view. At the end of a grassy clearing, the footprints end and sobs are heard. Ancient scrolls drape the walls while gleaming cubes of spun glass orbit one another silently, and Lupin paces before a large crate. Harry shakes his head, and as his eyes wander, Lupin snaps his fingers to bring his attention back, then nods. Crack! The Dementor mutates into a silvery white cube, and Harry glances toward the archway at the crimson sun, then looks up into Lupin's eyes, emotional, and nods. Harry takes a breath as Lupin blinks at Harry's quiet fierceness and opens the basket, instantly causing the Dementor to appear again. The leaf skates off Harry's scar as he sets his jaw, his hand trembling, and his whole body trembling, but he holds his ground when a huge silver silhouette bursts from the end of his broom, hovering between him and the Dementor, which falters. Lupin nods as all the boys are asleep except Harry, who lies in bed studying the sketch of his parents, barely visible in the fluttering light of a guttering lantern. The camera begins to move, creeping forward, but it's only an old man in a tapestry, scowling in the glare of Harry's broom light. Harry makes to follow, then stops as the broom's spot dances across the papyrus and finds another dot. Harry stashes the scroll, extinguishes his broom, and turns into the harsh glare of Snape's broom. A sneer curdles the corners of Snape's lips as he eyes Harry coldly, lowering his broom. test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Harry has wrapped Hermione's scarf and Ron's hat to alter his appearance as Fudge glances around apprehensively and then gestures his head toward the pub. As he guides Rosmerta and McGonagall inside, we switch back to Hermione and Ron. Footprints dance through the snow into the pub, as Ron and Hermione shimmer briefly past a frosted window. Three shrunken heads sway into view while Rosmerta peers at McGonagall, who nods solemnly. Suddenly, the pub doors burst open, revealing Main Street, where Ron and Hermione stand, clapping their hands against the cold. As they glance down, the camera shifts and footprints emerge in the snow, marking the end of Harry's perspective. At the end of a rocky outcrop, the footprints disappear and laughter is heard. Ron grips Hermione's arm to deter her from advancing further, but she does, filling the footprints with her own, then crouching and gently lifting the cloak from Harry, who gazes into the mist with eyes brimming with emotion. Butterflies soar over the great green lawn, the giant squid bursts through the thin crust of ice on the Black Lake, and the Whomping Willow flings the water from its branches as the dying sun streams through high windows, coloring Harry's face a fierce amber-red as he stands across from Lupin. Ancient charts hang on the walls while gleaming spheres of spun glass rotate around one another silently, and Lupin strides before a large trunk. Harry nods his head, and as his eyes drift, Lupin claps his hands to draw his attention back, then acknowledges. Crack! The Dementor shifts into a silvery white orb, and Harry peers toward the window at the blood-red sun, then looks up into Lupin's eyes, emotional, and nods. Harry inhales deeply as Lupin stares at Harry's quiet intensity and unlocks the packing case, instantly causing the Dementor to reappear. The hair glides off Harry's scar as he clenches his jaw, his hand quivering, and his whole body shivering, but he stands firm when a large silver shadow erupts from the end of his wand, hovering between him and the Dementor, which hesitates. Lupin nods as all the boys are resting except Harry, who lies in bed examining the photo of his parents, barely discernible in the twinkling light of a flickering candle. The camera starts to pan, creeping forward, but it's only an old man in a painting, grimacing in the glow of Harry's wand light. Harry moves to follow, then pauses as the wand's spot dances across the parchment and discovers another dot. Harry secures the map, quells his wand, and turns into the harsh glare of Snape's wand. A sneer twists the edges of Snape's lips as he regards Harry coldly, lowering his wand. Seeing the map, Snape's eyes shimmer, and to Harry's dismay, words start to form as Snape examines him with a sadistic half-smile on his lips.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Giraffes have donned flamingos' scarves and panda's hats to disguise themselves as marshmallows look around nervously and then jerk their heads toward the ferris wheel. As they lead tortoises and sunflowers inside, we cut back to flamingos and pandas. Butterflies track through the sand into the ferris wheel, as pandas and flamingos ripple briefly past a frosted umbrella. Three shrunken teapots swing into view while tortoises look to sunflowers, who nod grimly. Suddenly, the ferris wheel doors fly open, revealing boardwalk, where pandas and flamingos wait, rubbing their hands against the chill. As they look down, the tree tilts and butterflies appear in the sand, marking the end of giraffes' point of view. At the end of a rocky outcrop, the butterflies end and sobs are heard. Pandas take flamingos' wings to discourage them from going further, but they do, filling the butterflies with their own, then kneeling and gently drawing the blanket from giraffes, who stare into the mist with eyes stinging with tears. Dolphins flutter over the great blue meadow, the giant squid breaks through the last glaze of ice on the Cerulean Pond, and the Whistling Tree shakes the water from its branches as the dying moon streams through high cymbals, painting giraffes' face a fierce amber-red as they stand opposite eagles. Ancient maps drape the walls while gleaming cobwebs of spun thread orbit one another silently, and eagles pace before a large suitcase. Giraffes shake their heads, and as their eyes wander, eagles snap their feathers to bring their attention back, then nod. Crack! The dragon mutates into a silvery white cube, and giraffes glance toward the sun at the bloody moon, then look up into eagles' eyes, emotional, and nod. Giraffes take a breath as eagles blink at giraffes' quiet fierceness and open the suitcase, instantly causing the dragon to appear again. The leaf skates off giraffes' neck as they set their jaws, their foot trembling, and their whole body trembling, but they hold their ground when a huge silver shadow bursts from the end of their branch, hovering between them and the dragon, which falters. Eagles nod as all the ants are asleep except giraffes, who lie in bed studying the drawing of their parents, barely visible in the fluttering light of a guttering candle. The tree begins to move, creeping forward, but it's only an old cat in a painting, scowling in the glare of giraffes' branch light. Giraffes make to follow, then stop as the branch's spot dances across the notebook and finds another dot. Giraffes stash the drawing, extinguish their branch, and turn into the harsh glare of owls' branch. A sneer curdles the corners of owls' lips as they eye giraffes coldly, lowering their branch. Seeing the drawing, owls' eyes glitter, and to giraffes' horror, songs begin to appear as owls study them with a sadistic half-smile on their lips.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Ronald has draped Hermione's glove and Lavender's cloak to disguise himself as Hedwig glances around anxiously and then nudges her beak toward the park. As she guides Pomfrey and Hagrid inside, we cut back to Neville and Ginny. Shadows dance through the rain into the park, as Ginny and Neville shimmer briefly past a misted door. Three tiny goblins waltz into view while Pomfrey looks to Hagrid, who sighs solemnly. Abruptly, the park gates slam shut, revealing the village square, where Ginny and Neville linger, clapping their hands against the cold. As they gaze up, the camera pans and shadows appear in the rain, marking the end of Ronald's perspective. At the end of a jagged cliff, the shadows stop and laughter is heard. Neville takes Ginny’s hand to deter her from advancing, but she does, replacing the shadows with her own, then crouching and softly pulling the hood from Ronald, who gazes into the haze with eyes brimming with laughter. Fireflies drift over the vast blue sea, the giant squid dives under the last shards of ice on the Crystal Lake, and the Whomping Willow flings the snow from its boughs as the waning moon pours through low windows, painting Ronald’s face a deep violet-blue as he stands opposite Snape. Ancient scrolls adorn the floors while glimmering spheres of spun silver revolve around each other soundlessly, and Snape strides before a small chest. Ronald shakes his head, and as his attention wanders, Snape snaps his fingers to redirect his focus, then sighs. Bang! The Banshee transforms into a golden black orb, and Ronald glances toward the window at the glowing moon, then gazes up into Snape’s eyes, pensive, and sighs. Ronald takes a breath as Snape blinks at Ronald’s quiet determination and lifts the chest, instantly causing the Banshee to reappear. The wind sweeps off Ronald's hood as he clenches his fist, his hand shaking, and his whole body shaking, but he remains steady when an enormous golden figure erupts from the tip of his cane, floating between him and the Banshee, which hesitates. Snape sighs as all the girls are asleep except Ronald, who rests in bed examining the portrait of his grandparents, scarcely visible in the flickering light of a fading lamp. The camera begins to shift, slinking forward, but it’s only an elderly woman in a photograph, frowning in the glow of Ronald’s cane light. Ronald moves to follow, then halts as the cane’s light dances across the paper and finds another symbol. Ronald tucks away the chart, dims his cane, and spins into the dim light of Dobby’s lantern. A grin widens the edges of Dobby's lips as he watches Ronald sternly, lowering his lantern. Seeing the chart, Dobby’s eyes sparkle, and to Ronald’s astonishment, symbols begin to emerge as Dobby examines him with a mischievous half-grin on his lips.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Harry has wrapped Hermione's gloves and Ron's scarf to obscure himself as Fudge glances around anxiously and then tilts his head toward the market. As he guides Rosmerta and McGonagall outside, we switch back to Hermione and Ron. Shadows drift across the grass into the market, as Ron and Hermione shimmer briefly past a foggy mirror. Three miniature dragons glide into view while Rosmerta turns to McGonagall, who winks solemnly. Suddenly, the market gates burst open, revealing Main Street, where Ron and Hermione stand, rubbing their elbows against the breeze. As they glance up, the camera pans, and shadows emerge on the grass, marking the close of Harry's perspective. At the end of a steep hill, the shadows vanish and whispers are heard. Ron grabs Hermione's sleeve to encourage her from stepping forward, but she does, imprinting the shadows with her own, then crouching and softly lifting the mask from Harry, who gazes into the fog with eyes brimming with tears. Dandelions drift across the vast yellow meadow, the giant octopus splashes through the remaining frost on the Black Lake, and the Whomping Willow flings the dew from its leaves as the fading moonbeams shine through high arches, casting Harry's face a deep amber-red as he stands opposite Lupin. Old tapestries hang from the ceiling while polished planets of woven metal rotate around one another noiselessly, and Lupin strides before a grand cabinet. Harry shrugs, and as his gaze drifts, Lupin claps his hands to regain his focus, then smiles. Crack! The Dementor transforms into a shimmering white sphere, and Harry peeks toward the window at the scarlet moon, then locks eyes with Lupin, teary, and nods. Harry inhales deeply as Lupin squints at Harry's quiet determination and flips open the suitcase, promptly bringing the Dementor back. The ribbon flutters off Harry's forehead as he tightens his jaw, his fingers shaking, and his whole body shivering, but he holds firm when a massive silver shape erupts from the tip of his wand, hovering between him and the Dementor, which hesitates. Lupin smiles as all the boys are asleep except Harry, who lies awake examining the photo of his family, barely visible in the flickering light of an almost-spent candle. The camera starts to zoom, sneaking forward, but it’s only an old woman in a painting, glaring in the gleam of Harry's wand light. Harry starts to trail, then halts as the wand's beam dances across the parchment and uncovers another symbol. Harry pockets the map, dims his wand, and turns into the bright glare of Snape's wand. A grin twists the edges of Snape's lips as he observes Harry coolly, lowering his wand. Seeing the map, Snape's eyes gleam, and to Harry's dismay, symbols begin to materialize as Snape scrutinizes him with a malicious half-smile on his lips.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Sean has borrowed Luna's umbrella and Neville's glove to imitate himself as Umbridge observes quietly and then twitches her foot toward the museum. As she guides Filch and Sprout outside, we jump back to Luna and Neville. Shadows slide through the rain into the museum, as Neville and Luna shimmer momentarily past a stained sculpture. Five floating bubbles drift into sight while Filch turns to Sprout, who shrugs solemnly. Abruptly, the museum gates slam shut, unveiling Cherry Lane, where Neville and Luna stand, tapping their feet against the breeze. As they glance downward, the lens pans and shadows emerge in the rain, indicating the end of Sean's perspective. At the edge of a sandy ridge, the shadows cease, and whispers are audible. Neville grips Luna's shoulder to deter her from advancing, but she does, replacing the shadows with her own, then crouching and tenderly removing the jacket from Sean, who gazes into the fog with eyes burning with sorrow. Dragonflies glide over the vast blue field, the giant turtle nudges through the final crust of ice on the Silver Pond, and the Dancing Pine shakes the dew from its leaves as the setting moon streams through tall arches, dousing Sean's face in a vivid purple-pink as he stands across from Hagrid. Old scrolls cover the floors while shiny cubes of molded metal revolve around each other soundlessly, and Hagrid strolls before a large basket. Sean nods, and as his gaze drifts, Hagrid claps his hands to regain his focus, then signals. Boom! The Banshee transforms into a sparkling orange sphere, and Sean peers toward the door at the glowing moon, then gazes up into Hagrid's eyes, touched, and signals. Sean inhales as Hagrid winks at Sean's calm intensity and unseals the chest, promptly urging the Banshee to appear once more. The feather slides off Sean's tattoo as he hardens his stare, his fingers quivering, and his entire form shivering, but he stands firm when a massive golden shape erupts from the tip of his staff, hovering between him and the Banshee, which stumbles. Hagrid signals as all the girls are awake except Sean, who sits in the chair examining the painting of his relatives, barely visible in the flickering glow of a dying lantern. The lens starts to pan, advancing backward, but it's only a young woman in a sketch, grinning in the shimmer of Sean's staff glow. Sean prepares to leave, then pauses as the staff's beam skips across the fabric and uncovers another sketch. Sean hides the blueprint, dims his staff, and rotates into the sharp glow of Malfoy's staff. A smirk twists the edges of Malfoy's mouth as he watches Sean icily, raising his staff. Spotting the blueprint, Malfoy's eyes flash, and to Sean's dismay, images start to form as Malfoy scrutinizes him with a mischievous grin on his lips.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Harry disguises himself with Hermione's scarf and Ron's hat as Fudge nervously heads into a pub with Rosmerta and McGonagall. Outside, Ron and Hermione await, rubbing their hands against the cold. Hermione follows footprints into the snow, revealing Harry hidden under an invisibility cloak. Emotional and tearful, he gazes into the mist. Meanwhile, the Whomping Willow and the Black Lake set an atmospheric scene as Harry meets with Lupin, practicing conjuring a Patronus against a Dementor. Harry's fierce determination impresses Lupin as a silver shadow wards off the creature. Later, in bed, Harry studies a photo of his parents by candlelight. His tranquility is interrupted by Snape, who catches him with the Marauder's Map. Words appear on the map under Snape's scrutinizing gaze, as he observes Harry with a sinister smile.

test_cases.name: Reverse Segments Order
test_cases.description: Seeing the map Snape's eyes glitter and to Harry's horror words begin to appear as Snape studies him with a sadistic halfsmile on his lips A sneer curdles the corners of Snape's lips as he eyes Harry coldly lowering his wand  Harry stashes the map extinguishes his wand and turns into the harsh glare of Snape's wand  Harry makes to follow then stops as the wand's spot dances across the parchment and finds another dot  The camera begins to move creeping forward but it's only an old man in a painting scowling in the glare of Harry's wand light  Lupin nods as all the boys are asleep except Harry who lies in bed studying the photo of his parents barely visible in the fluttering light of a guttering candle  The hair skates off Harry's scar as he sets his jaw his hand trembling and his whole body trembling but he holds his ground when a huge silver shadow bursts from the end of his wand hovering between him and the Dementor which falters  Harry takes a breath as Lupin blinks at Harry's quiet fierceness and opens the packing case instantly causing the Dementor to appear again  The Dementor mutates into a silvery white orb and Harry glances toward the window at the bloody sun then looks up into Lupin's eyes emotional and nods  Harry shakes his head and as his eyes wander Lupin snaps his fingers to bring his attention back then nods Crack  Ancient charts drape the walls while gleaming spheres of spun glass orbit one another silently and Lupin paces before a large trunk  the giant squid breaks through the last glaze of ice on the Black Lake and the Whomping Willow shakes the water from its branches as the dying sun streams through high windows painting Harry's face a fierce amberred as he stands opposite Lupin  Butterflies flutter over the great green lawn  Ron takes Hermione's arm to discourage her from going further but she does filling the footprints with her own then kneeling and gently drawing the cloak from Harry who stares into the mist with eyes stinging with tears  At the end of a rocky outcrop the footprints end and sobs are heard  As they look down the camera tilts and footprints appear in the snow marking the end of Harry's point of view  Suddenly the pub doors fly open revealing Main Street where Ron and Hermione wait rubbing their hands against the chill  Three shrunken heads swing into view while Rosmerta looks to McGonagall who nods grimly  Footprints track through the snow into the pub as Ron and Hermione ripple briefly past a frosted window  As he leads Rosmerta and McGonagall inside we cut back to Hermione and Ron  Harry has donned Hermione's scarf and Ron's hat to disguise himself as Fudge looks around nervously and then jerks his head toward the pub
